Question: Why do they cultivate the concentrations in combination?
Answer: There are three reasons for cultivating the concentrations in combination.
First, because of delight in the attainments.
Second, because of fear of the afflictions.
Third, because of delight in rebirth.
Those who delight in the attainments do so in order to abide in the present bliss,
or in order to enjoy the wealth of the holy Dharma,
or in order to play with the merits,
or in order to observe what has been done,
or in order to attract superior merits.
Those who fear the afflictions do so because they fear the arising of afflictions and the loss of superior merits.
Or they fear the arising of afflictions and the burning of body and mind.
Those who delight in rebirth do so because they delight in being born in the five pure abodes not shared by ordinary beings.
Those with faith and understanding cultivate the concentrations in combination for all three reasons.
Those who have attained insight cultivate the concentrations in combination for two reasons.
Excluding fear of the afflictions, because they are not subject to retrogression.
Those with time-liberation cultivate the concentrations in combination for two reasons, excluding delight in rebirth, because they turn their backs on all births.
Ascetics liberated not subject to time mix the meditations for one reason, to avoid being disturbed by the passions and to enjoy rebirth.
Because they do not retrogress and because they turn their backs on all rebirths.

Question: If this type turns, does this type follow, or does another type?
Answer: Some say:
If this type turns, this type follows.
That is to say, the objects, aspects, and foundations of mindfulness of wisdom must be mutually compatible in order to accomplish mixed cultivation.
Therefore, if this turns, this must follow. Otherwise, it would be an obstacle to mixed cultivation.
Some say:
If this type turns, another type follows.
That is to say, the objects, aspects, and foundations of mindfulness of wisdom must be of different kinds in order to accomplish mixed cultivation.
Therefore, if this is the turning, the other must be the following. Otherwise, it would contradict the meaning of mixed cultivation.
Those who explain it this way say:
This is not fixed.
If dharma cognition is the turning,
either dharma cognition or inferential cognition is the following.
If inferential cognition is the turning,
either inferential cognition or dharma cognition is the following.
The other cognitions are also like this.
If conditioned phenomena are the object of the turning,
either conditioned phenomena or unconditioned phenomena are the object of the following.
The objects of other phenomena are also like this.
If impermanence is the aspect of the turning,
either impermanence or suffering, etc., are the aspects of the following.
The other aspects are also like this.
If the mindfulness of the body is the turning,
either the mindfulness of the body or the mindfulness of feeling, etc., are the following.
The other mindfulnesses are also like this.
Question: If the turning and the following are sometimes different, then because of the confusion of aspects and objects,
why does it not create an obstacle for mixed cultivation of the meditative absorptions?
The answer is that because they have already been well cultivated in the stage of added effort,
the path has already been formed. Even though they are mixed, they do not create obstacles to the mixed cultivation.
Just as in the path of insight and the worldly path, even though the aspects and objects are mixed and confused,
there are no obstacles. This is also like that.

Moreover, the sages seek to be born in the pure abodes because they are disgusted with being born in the same place as ordinary beings.

Moreover, the noble ones seek to be born in the Pure Abodes because they are disgusted with the calamities and afflictions of the lower realms.
Since there are calamities and afflictions in the lower three realms, there are no Pure Abodes there.
Moreover, the long lifespan of the Pure Abodes is due to the superior karma that gives rise to them.
If there were [Pure Abodes] in the lower realms, would those whose lifespans are fixed in the three calamities die or not?
If they die, then their fixed lifespan should not be cut short.
If they do not die, then they should obstruct the calamities from arising.
As it is said, In a place where there is a single sentient being, down to an ant egg, the calamities will not destroy it.
In order to avoid such errors, there are no Pure Abodes in the lower realms.
The Venerable Vasumitra said:
Why are there no Pure Abodes in the lower realms?
One is born in the Pure Abodes by practicing the dhyanas in a mixed way.
When practicing the dhyanas in a mixed way, one must have already become free from the afflictions of the lower three realms.
One cannot be reborn in a realm from which one has already become free from afflictions.
Therefore, the Pure Abodes are not found in the lower realms.
Moreover, only those with sharp faculties are able to practice the dhyanas in a mixed way.
Those who are able to mix and cultivate must be able to quickly transcend the lower impure stages and reach the completely pure realm, therefore there are no pure abodes in the lower stages.
Moreover, they must attain the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception in order to be able to mix and cultivate.
Those who are able to mix and cultivate are born in that realm, therefore there are no pure abodes in the lower stages.
The Venerable One said:
Sentient beings in the lower stages are often born in the upper realms when the world is destroyed and born in the lower realms when it is formed.
Those born in the pure abodes do not have such things, therefore there are no pure abodes in the lower stages.

Question: Then why does the mixed cultivation of meditative absorption only have five types and not increase or decrease?
